metadata.title: CVE-2024-26751 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ARM:ep93xx: Add terminator to gpiod_lookup_table Without the terminator, if acon_id is passed to gpio_find() that does not exist in the lookup table thefunction will not stop looping correctly, and eventually cause an oops.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26751` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-186-generic - 5.4.0-186.206~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-186-lowlatency - 5.4.0-186.206~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1126-aws - 5.4.0-1126.136~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1131-azure - 5.4.0-1131.138~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1130-gcp - 5.4.0-1130.139~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1073-ibm - 5.4.0-1073.78~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1125-oracle - 5.4.0-1125.134~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-1110-raspi - 5.4.0-1110.122~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
